title: Indian Penal Code - Section 302
content:
Punishment for Murder.
        Whoever commits murder shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a 
        term which may extend to life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend 
        to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, or to both. Exception: Death by accident 
        during lawful act is not murder.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 420
content:
Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property.
        Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any 
        property to any person, or to make, alter or destroy the whole or any part of a valuable 
        security, or anything which is signed or sealed, with the intent that it may be used as 
        a valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term 
        which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 354
content:
Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Outrage Modesty.
        Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending to outrage or knowing 
        it to be likely that he will thereby outrage the modesty of that person, shall be punished 
        with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to two 
        thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 376
content:
Punishment for Rape.
        Whoever commits rape shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a 
        term which shall not be less than seven years but which may be for life, and shall also 
        be liable to fine. Rape may be committed even without penetration if there is physical 
        contact with sexual intent.

title: Indian Penal Code - Section 498A
content:
Cruelty by Husband or His Relative.
        Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman 
        to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years 
        and shall also be liable to fine which may extend to one thousand rupees.

title: Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita - Section 101
content:
Punishment for Murder.
        Whoever commits murder shall be punished with life imprisonment or imprisonment up to 
        twenty years. This is part of new criminal code replacing IPC Section 302.
